title: Improving Speech Recognition Accuracy Using Custom Language Models with the Vosk Toolkit
author: Aniket Abhishek Soni (Southern Arkansas University), ..., Aniket Abhishek Soni
relevance_why: This paper discusses the integration of custom language models which can enhance the performance of speech recognition systems. This can be directly relevant to improving audio processing tasks and models that involve speech and language.
background: The paper focuses on enhancing speech recognition accuracy by utilizing custom language models within the Vosk Toolkit, targeted at various audio formats and conditions.
contribution: This paper introduces a transcription pipeline that incorporates custom language models with the Vosk Toolkit to improve speech-to-text accuracy notably in technical and varied acoustic environments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models often struggle with domain-specific vocabulary and background noise, especially when using generic models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work significantly boosts accuracy by employing custom language models tailored for specific terminologies and contexts, showcasing a marked decrease in word error rates.

key_innovation: The ability to utilize and train custom language models in an offline environment for diverse audio formats makes it versatile and accessible for various applications.
real_world_impact: The approach provides a practical, cost-effective solution for organizations needing accurate offline speech recognition, particularly in sensitive or low-connectivity environments.
limitations: Limits mentioned include the constraint to single-speaker, pre-recorded audio without explicit handling for audio preprocessing like denoising.

new_terms.word error rate (WER): **Word error rate (WER)** is a common metric for evaluating the accuracy of speech recognition systems, calculated as the number of errors in the recognized text divided by the total words in the reference text.

open_sourcing: The Vosk Toolkit is open-source, allowing for further customization and improvement by the community.
